newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Cheong Ming says IPO 16.9 times subscribed.
newsitem.headline: HK's Cheong Ming says IPO 16.9 times subscribed.

text.p: Printing concern Cheong Ming Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday its initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Hong Kong was 16.9 times subscribed.

Cheong Ming said in a statement it had received applications for a total 1.22 billion shares compared with 72 million shares available for public subscription. Another 8.0 million shares for staff were fully allotted, it said.
It said dealing in the shares would begin on January 20.
The company offered 80 million shares at HK$1.00 per share in an initial public offering.
It said net proceeds would be used to buy machinery, to fund the construction of a printing factory in Dongguan in China's Guangdong province, and for working capital.
